content:
Apologies for the oversight. Here's an updated Costco grocery list to feed two people for a week, considering your preferences and Costco's larger quantities:

1. Fresh produce:
	* 1 bag of mixed greens (use for salads, sandwiches, and wraps throughout the week)
	* 1 bag of apples (for snacking or use in recipes)
	* 1 bag of baby carrots (snack on these throughout the week or use in meals)
	* 1 bag of frozen mixed vegetables (cook as needed for meals)
	* 1 bag of frozen berries (for smoothies)
2. Proteins:
	* 1 pack of boneless, skinless chicken breasts (freeze half for future use)
	* 1 pack of 24 eggs (use for breakfast, in recipes, or store extra in the refrigerator for up to 5 weeks)
	* 1 pack of salmon fillets (freeze any extras for future use)
3. Grains:
	* 2 loaves of whole grain bread (freeze one loaf for future use)
	* 1 bag of brown rice or quinoa (store excess in the pantry for future use)
4. Dairy-free alternatives:
	* 1 tub of dairy-free yogurt (use in smoothies, as a snack, or in recipes)
	* 1 pack of almond milk or other non-dairy milk (use in smoothies or with cereal)
5. Pantry items:
	* 1 jar of peanut butter (use for sandwiches or as a snack)
	* 1 bag of almonds (snack on these or use in recipes)
6. Snacks:
	* 1 box of whole grain crackers (consume throughout the week as needed)
7. Breakfast items:
	* 1 large container of oatmeal (store excess in the pantry for future use)

Feel free to swap out items or adjust the list based on your preferences and needs. Since Costco's quantities are larger, consider meal prepping or freezing any leftovers to avoid food waste.
